snippet: Local stations can and should challenge third-party advertisers, including super PACs, to prove the accuracy of their political ads.
abstract: Editorial, prompted local Ohio television stations that pulled a misleading political ad aired by a third-party group, supports proposal being considered by the Federal Communications Commission that would require stations to reveal which groups are buying ads along with the amount of money these groups are spending.
lead_paragraph: Local stations can and should challenge third-party advertisers, including super PACs, to prove the accuracy of their political ads.
